question.body: Margot doesn’t give much thought to how she approaches OLI Statistics; she just goes to a unit, tries a few activities, then does the Checkpoint. Sometimes she does well, sometimes she doesn’t. She’s really not sure how she’ll do on the final exam. Margot has not

multiple_choice.choice: evaluated her own strengths and weaknesses.
planned a strategy for working through the course.

response.feedback: Correct. Margot hasn't assessed the task at all.
Correct. Margot has not bothered to evaluate her own strengths and weaknesses.
Correct. Margot doesn’t really have a strategy; she’s just trying things without giving her approach much thought.
Correct. Margot isn’t monitoring her own performance, which is why she has no idea what is and isn’t working, or how prepared she is for the final exam.
Correct. By failing to monitor her performance throughout the course, Margot has denied herself the opportunity to reflect on and adjust her approach.
